meanings.definition: To walk in a proud or confident manner.
meanings.sent1: She was strunting down the hallway after receiving her award.
meanings.sent2: The model was strunting on the runway with elegance.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help but strunt a little after acing the test.
meanings.sent4: The peacock strunted around the garden, showing off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent5: The superhero strunted into the room, ready to save the day.

meanings.definition: The act of showing off or flaunting.
meanings.sent1: Her constant strunting about her achievements annoyed her classmates.
meanings.sent2: The strunting of wealth by some people can be off-putting.
meanings.sent3: The peacock's strunting of its feathers caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The strunting of the new sports car turned heads on the street.
meanings.sent5: His strunting of his knowledge made him seem arrogant.

meanings.definition: A display of arrogance or conceit.
meanings.sent1: His strunting about his success made others feel inferior.
meanings.sent2: The strunting of the celebrity was evident in every interview.
meanings.sent3: The cat's strunting around the house made it clear who was in charge.
meanings.sent4: Her strunting of her designer clothes made her the talk of the town.
meanings.sent5: The politician's strunting caused many to question his sincerity.
